ARABIC: وَأَن لَّيْسَ لِلْإِنسَٰنِ إِلَّا مَا سَعَىٰ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: that man will have nothing but what he strives for;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: That a man receives but only that for which he strives;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and that man shall have nothing but what he has striven for,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: nor can man achieve anything without hard labor.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And that man will not obtain anything except what he strove for?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And that man can have nothing but what he does.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And that man shall have nothing but what he strives for-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and that a man shall have to his account only as he has laboured,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And that man hath only that for which he maketh effort,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and that man shall have only that for which he strives;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And that for man shall be naught save that wherefor he endeavoureth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: that nothing belongs to man except what he strives for,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: That man can have nothing but what he strives for;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And that man can have nothing but what he does (good or bad).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: and that everyone shall have in his account only that which he worked for,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And that the human being attains only what he strives for.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And that there is not for man except that [good] for which he strives
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [53:39] and that (wa-an, to be understood as wa-annahu) man shall have only what he [himself] strives for, of good [deeds], and so he shall not have anything of [the reward for] good [deeds] striven for by another;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And that man) on the Day of Judgement (hath only that for which he maketh effort) he has only that which he has earned of good or evil in the life of the world, 624
